title: Fruit anatomy
summary: Fruit anatomy is the plant anatomy of the internal structure of fruit.[1][2] Fruits are the mature ovary or ovaries of one or more flowers. They are found in three main anatomical categories: aggregate fruits, multiple fruits, and simple fruits. Aggregate fruits are formed from a single compound flower and contain many ovaries or fruitlets.[3] Examples include raspberries and blackberries. Multiple fruits are formed from the fused ovaries of multiple flowers or inflorescence.[3] Examples include fig, mulberry, and pineapple.[3]
